from abc import ABC, abstractmethod\n\
\n\
class BaseClass(ABC):\n    @abstractmethod\n    def method_1(self) -> str:\n        pass\n\n    @overload\n    @abstractmethod\n    def method_2(self, arg1: int, arg2: float = 0.0) -> float:\n        ...\n\n    @overload\n    @abstractmethod\n    def method_2(self, *args: Any) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n        ...\n\
\n\
class DerivedClass(BaseClass):\n    def method_1(self) -> str:\n        return 'Result from method 1'\n\n    @final\n    def method_2(self, arg1: int, arg2: float = 0.0) -> float:\n        return arg1 + arg2\n\
\n\
def custom_subclasshook(cls, obj):\n    if isinstance(obj, DerivedClass)\n        or (isinstance(obj, BaseClass) and hasattr(obj, 'method_1') and callable(getattr(obj, 'method_1'))):\n        return True\n    return NotImplemented\n\
\n\
ABCMeta.__subclasshook__ = custom_subclasshook\n\
```"
